vision.notes: Likely relied on strong eyesight for hunting, inferred from similarity to modern great white sharks and anatomical analysis revealing facial and optical structures.

mechanoreception.notes: Sharks possess a lateral line system for detecting vibrations and pressure changes in the water. Given their active predatory lifestyle, this would likely be a well-developed sense.

electroreception.notes: As elasmobranchs, they likely possessed ampullae of Lorenzini for detecting electric fields in water. Useful for detecting prey.

olfaction.notes: Sharks generally have a well-developed sense of smell for detecting prey from a distance.

taste/chemoreception.notes: Taste buds in the mouth and chemoreceptors for detecting chemical cues in the water are likely present.
